messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:31): Unread 2345
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:31): making progress

8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:33): Then I suspect soon :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:34): the first 10k was the easiest :)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:35): Also, I was happy to see you agreed with this editor :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:40): http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-melnikov-mime-default-charset whoa
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:41): jreschke aligning some outdated spec with implementations rather than claiming the implementations are broken
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:42): makes a note for WHATWG Weekly
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:45): If you hadn't seen it yet, https://github.com/andreasgal/dom.js
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:46): sweet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:47): is this sponsored by Mozilla now he figured out just selling books does not work? :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:47): oh, David Flanagan was just the last to make a checkin
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:53): very cool
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:54): Yeah, we're doing something new for once ;)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:54): I saw in the logs experiments with removing mutation events are starting too
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:55): I wonder if the replacement needs to be part of DOM Core
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:02): Ah, I found and replied to the email where bz rightly claims DOM Core would not be a proper specification without mutation events

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:04): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: by the way, recent discussion in here raised the question of how dom core should deal with those weird events where dispatching them causes default behavior (onclick in particular, onsubmit in everything but WebKit) ... not urgent, just mentioning it while I'm remembering it since it was off-list
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (00:05): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, what do you think about document.ownerDocument, while you're in that thread?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:05): oh yeah, I agree with Ian that submit is bug
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:06): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, if we can change browsers, works for me
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:07): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, that a Document owns itself makes sense to me :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:07): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6, and I think I agree with you that we should just treat them as distinct concepts
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:07): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6, dispatching and whatever you do if the event was not canceled
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:11): mpilgrim: BTW I would love for the final argument to addEventListener to be optional, so let's try to fix the platform :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:11): Also, commiserations on the perl

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:12): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6, 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, also, I think using the empty string rather than a hidden flag is the way to go for uninitialized events
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:12): (re: long time ago)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:12): knows no perl and was trying to add features to a largish, test-free, perl codebase the other day
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:12): i agree, figured I'd wait until you were back to grumble further about that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:13): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, it's already optional
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:13): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, see DOM Core
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:13): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: It does have tests. About four.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (00:13): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, been hacking on WebKit's IDL parser?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:13): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Right. So let's not let mpilgrim make it non-optional in WebKit :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:14): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Not covering the bit I was modifying though
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (00:14): I was *so* tempted to rewrite that bit in python  and work out how to call perl from python...
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:15): heh, i rewrote all of my old perl stuff in python long ago, fortunately I've never written anything *big* in Perl
